metadata.Title: CVE-2021-40330 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
git_connect_git in connect.c in Git before 2.30.1 allows a repository path to contain a newline character, which may result in unexpected cross-protocol requests, as demonstrated by the git://localhost:1234/%0d%0a%0d%0aGET%20/%20HTTP/1.1 substring.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-40330` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

git - 1:2.25.1-1ubuntu3.2
git-all - 1:2.25.1-1ubuntu3.2
git-cvs - 1:2.25.1-1ubuntu3.2
git-daemon-run - 1:2.25.1-1ubuntu3.2
git-daemon-sysvinit - 1:2.25.1-1ubuntu3.2
git-el - 1:2.25.1-1ubuntu3.2
git-email - 1:2.25.1-1ubuntu3.2
git-gui - 1:2.25.1-1ubuntu3.2
git-man - 1:2.25.1-1ubuntu3.2
git-mediawiki - 1:2.25.1-1ubuntu3.2
git-svn - 1:2.25.1-1ubuntu3.2
gitk - 1:2.25.1-1ubuntu3.2
gitweb - 1:2.25.1-1ubuntu3.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: git package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.25.1-1ubuntu3.2').
